attributes.action: Allow Petitions Committee pass motions of no confidence in Government Ministers
attributes.additional_details:
Received the following email this morning.

"The Petitions Committee decided not to debate the petition you signed – “Consider a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt, Health Secretary”

The House of Commons Petitions Committee has decided not to schedule a debate on this petition, because the Committee does not have the power to schedule debates on motions of no confidence, and the petition does not contain a specific request for action on policy."
attributes.background: Currently there is no possibility of the Petitions Committee considering Public Motions of No Confidence in the actions of Government Ministers.  This means that the public can not hold Ministers directly to account for actions they take "In our name". This is unjust and should be changed.
